Posted By: sarroth (7/25/2011 9:08:09 PM)
Rating:

@JarieSuicune: The controller of the attacking creature need only apply "lethal" damage to the Phytohydra before assigning its trample damage to the defending player. If the Phytohydra had no +1/+1 counters on it, then only one point of damage would need to be assigned.

The damage would then turn into a +1/+1 counter, but at that point, the damage would have already been assigned, so the Phytohydra wouldn't suddenly block more damage. Additionally, unless the trample damage was done with first (or double) strike, the counter would be placed after the assign damage step, so Phytohydra would also only hit back for 1.

Of course, since it's technically the attacking player's choice, he or she could theoretically assign more than lethal damage to the Phytohydra. This would only cause it to grow more, and would reduce the amount of trample damage dealt to the defending player.

posts.post_content: Not that I dont love this card, but i feel like saying that it almost caused a fistfight between a good friend and I. we were locked in an hour long endurance match, when i finally had the mana to beef my creature up to a 13/13 with trample, which will end the game. Until my buddy blocks me with his just played phytohydra which is only a 1/1 with no counters as of yet, he proceeds to block my behemoth with trample and tells me that he gets 13 +1+1 counters on the hydra.... after a heated argument i finally gave up and told him to do whatever... guess what happens next round... thats right he overruns me and wins the match.... until i checked the discussion on the card and low and behold he could only take 1 +1+1 counters and take the rest of the trample damage... good card as long as everyone is clear on the rules. I DID GET THE LAST LAUPH THOUGH.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: One of the best cards from the Ravnica block. The [Pariah](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pariah) and [Pariah's Shield](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pariah's Shield ) combos are superb. The only bad thing about thiscard is that it has no protection form destroy spells. The solution: [Privileged Position](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Privileged Position ) and [Shield of the Oversoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shield of the Oversoul).
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but the Photohydra's ability isn't damage prevention. The way it's worded makes it look like a replacement effect, so even if the damage is unpreventable, the Photohydra still doesn't die. No matter how it would take damage, it doesn't. Instead, it gets that many +1/+1 counters.  
Now that I think of it, isn't this one of the only creatures with a replacement effect on received damage?
posts.html:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but the Photohydra's ability isn't damage prevention. The way it's worded makes it look like a replacement effect, so even if the damage is unpreventable, the Photohydra still doesn't die. No matter how it would take damage, it doesn't.
